messages.message:
In accuracy testing, I created a ground truth dataset with v0.0.1 by going through 40 records ensuring accuracy for every field (300+ total fields). I then changed the names of a few fields & deleted a few others in v0.1.0 and tried to run an accuracy test using the same golden from v0.0.1. It asked me to update the dataset to reflect the changed schema so I did, and it reran the app and wiped all the changes I made in the initial run.

I think ground truth datasets should be more "protected" since it currently does take a long time to configure the first time, and having to reconfigure it is a big pain. App schema changing in between versions should be a fairly common scenario and we should account for it (e.g. running accuracy metrics only on the classes & fields that are available on the current app version, or asking to create a new version of the ground truth dataset to account for the new schema)
I think at the very least now there should be a warning that updating dataset will override the existing golden

24.44 is the version on aihub.instabase.com (http://aihub.instabase.com), and we should preserve the changes you made in the initial version of the ground truth set before the rerun :disappointed:

i’ll try creating a ground truth set and rerunning it to reproduce this
can you send me the link to your project so that i can try to mimic your Build project as much as possible?

https://aihub.instabase.com/build/0192df4b-a579-7c4c-b44e-269911905f84 if it's too much effort please don't! I probably won't iterate many more times after this and can set something up in Excel easier for now. Thank you though

also, you should be able to run accuracy tests with outdated ground truth sets in 24.44

trying to reproduce the case where the UI asked you to update the dataset :loading:

i created a ground truth set -> deleted and updated a field in the associated Build project -> published a new app version

and i was still able to run an accuracy test with the ground truth set - did you see something different?

i edited 3 field values before i created the new app version

after rerunning the outdated ground truth sets, my edits are still preserved :disappointed:

Thanks for looking into this. It's likely the case that I saw "Outdated" under the ground truth dataset before running, went to check on the ground truth dataset, thought that I had to update it before running from the popup message, and updated it. I'll take a closer look tomorrow. If it is possible to run on outdated dataset, that's great, I don't think I thought that way initially
I'll take a closer look tomorrow!

the ground truth set was created using v0.0.1 and was rerun using v0.1.0? or rerun using 0.1.1?

the only difference i can find between 0.0.1 and 0.1.1 is that you renamed “US Permanent RAC” to “US Permanent Resident Alien Card” -> if you rename a class, we won’t preserve the field values that you modified in the ground truth set under that renamed class :disappointed:
